info.title: List of Dconf Keys of MATE Desktop

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.accessibility-keyboard

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/enable $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard enable
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/feature-state-change-beep $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard feature-state-change-beep
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/timeout-enable $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard timeout-enable
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/timeout $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard timeout
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/bouncekeys-enable $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard bouncekeys-enable

listitem.para: (i) Ignore multiple presses of the _same_ key within @delay milliseconds.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/bouncekeys-delay $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard bouncekeys-delay
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/bouncekeys-beep-reject $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard bouncekeys-beep-reject
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/mousekeys-enable $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard mousekeys-enable

listitem.para: (i) How many pixels per second to move at the maximum speed.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/mousekeys-max-speed $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard mousekeys-max-speed

listitem.para: (i) How many milliseconds it takes to go from 0 to maximum speed.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/mousekeys-accel-time $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard mousekeys-accel-time

listitem.para: (i) How many milliseconds to wait before mouse movement keys start to operate.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/mousekeys-init-delay $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard mousekeys-init-delay
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/slowkeys-enable $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard slowkeys-enable

listitem.para: (i) Do not accept a key as being pressed unless held for @delay milliseconds.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/slowkeys-delay $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard slowkeys-delay
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/slowkeys-beep-press $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard slowkeys-beep-press
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/slowkeys-beep-accept $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard slowkeys-beep-accept
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/slowkeys-beep-reject $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard slowkeys-beep-reject
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/stickykeys-enable $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard stickykeys-enable

listitem.para: (b) Latch modifiers when pressed twice in a row until the same modifier is pressed again.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/stickykeys-latch-to-lock $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard stickykeys-latch-to-lock

listitem.para: (b) Disable if two keys are pressed at the same time.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/stickykeys-two-key-off $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard stickykeys-two-key-off

listitem.para: (b) Beep when a modifier is pressed.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/stickykeys-modifier-beep $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard stickykeys-modifier-beep
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/keyboard/togglekeys-enable $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-keyboard togglekeys-enable

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/startup/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/startup/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.accessibility-startup

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (as) List of assistive technology applications to start when logging into the MATE desktop.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/accessibility/startup/exec-ats $ gsettings get org.mate.accessibility-startup exec-ats

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/applications/at/mobility/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/applications/at/mobility/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.applications-at-mobility

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) Preferred Mobility assistive technology application to be used for login, menu, or command line.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/at/mobility/exec $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-at-mobility exec

listitem.para: (b) MATE to start preferred Mobility assistive technology application during login.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/at/mobility/startup $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-at-mobility startup

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/applications/at/visual/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/applications/at/visual/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.applications-at-visual

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) Preferred Visual assistive technology application to be used for login, menu, or command line.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/at/visual/exec $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-at-visual exec

listitem.para: (b) MATE to start preferred Visual assistive technology application during login.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/at/visual/startup $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-at-visual startup

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/applications/browser/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/applications/browser/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.applications-browser

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) Default browser for all URLs.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/browser/exec $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-browser exec

listitem.para: (b) Whether the default browser needs a terminal to run.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/browser/needs-term $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-browser needs-term

listitem.para: (b) Whether the default browser understands netscape remote.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/browser/nremote $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-browser nremote

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/applications/calculator/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/applications/calculator/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.applications-calculator

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) Calculator program to use when starting applications that require one.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/calculator/exec $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-calculator exec

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/applications/calendar/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/applications/calendar/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.applications-office.calendar

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) Default calendar application

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/calendar/exec $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-office.calendar exec

listitem.para: (b) Whether the default calendar application needs a terminal to run

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/calendar/needs-term $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-office.calendar needs-term

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/applications/tasks/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/applications/tasks/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.applications-office.tasks

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) Default tasks application

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/tasks/exec $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-office.tasks exec

listitem.para: (b) Whether the default tasks application needs a terminal to run

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/tasks/needs-term $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-office.tasks needs-term

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/applications/terminal/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/applications/terminal/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.applications-terminal

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) Terminal program to use when starting applications that require one.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/terminal/exec $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-terminal exec

listitem.para: (s) Argument used to execute programs in the terminal defined by the 'exec' key.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/applications/terminal/exec-arg $ gsettings get org.mate.applications-terminal exec-arg

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/background/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/background/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.background

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (b) Have MATE draw the desktop background.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/draw-background $ gsettings get org.mate.background draw-background

listitem.para: (b) Have MATE file manager (Caja) draw the desktop icons.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/show-desktop-icons $ gsettings get org.mate.background show-desktop-icons

listitem.para: (b) If set to true, then MATE will change the desktop background with a fading effect.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/background-fade $ gsettings get org.mate.background background-fade

listitem.para: () Determines how the image set by wallpaper_filename is rendered. Possible values are "wallpaper", "centered", "scaled", "stretched", "zoom", "spanned".

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/picture-options $ gsettings get org.mate.background picture-options

listitem.para: (s) File to use for the background image.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/picture-filename $ gsettings get org.mate.background picture-filename

listitem.para: (i) Opacity with which to draw the background picture.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/picture-opacity $ gsettings get org.mate.background picture-opacity

listitem.para: (s) Left or Top color when drawing gradients, or the solid color.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/primary-color $ gsettings get org.mate.background primary-color

listitem.para: (s) Right or Bottom color when drawing gradients, not used for solid color.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/secondary-color $ gsettings get org.mate.background secondary-color

listitem.para: () How to shade the background color. Possible values are "horizontal-gradient", "vertical-gradient", and "solid".

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/background/color-shading-type $ gsettings get org.mate.background color-shading-type

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/debug/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/debug/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.debug

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/debug/caja $ gsettings get org.mate.debug caja
$ dconf read /org/mate/debug/marco $ gsettings get org.mate.debug marco
$ dconf read /org/mate/debug/mate-session $ gsettings get org.mate.debug mate-session
$ dconf read /org/mate/debug/mate-settings-daemon $ gsettings get org.mate.debug mate-settings-daemon
$ dconf read /org/mate/debug/mate-panel $ gsettings get org.mate.debug mate-panel

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/file-views/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/file-views/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.file-views

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) Theme used for displaying file icons.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/file-views/icon-theme $ gsettings get org.mate.file-views icon-theme

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/interface/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/interface/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.interface

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (b) Whether Applications should have accessibility support.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/accessibility $ gsettings get org.mate.interface accessibility

listitem.para: (b) Whether animations should be displayed. Note: This is a global key, it changes the behaviour of the window manager, the panel etc.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/enable-animations $ gsettings get org.mate.interface enable-animations

listitem.para: (b) Whether menus should have a tearoff.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/menus-have-tearoff $ gsettings get org.mate.interface menus-have-tearoff

listitem.para: (s) Toolbar Style. Valid values are "both", "both-horiz", "icons", and "text".

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/toolbar-style $ gsettings get org.mate.interface toolbar-style

listitem.para: (b) Whether menus may display an icon next to a menu entry.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/menus-have-icons $ gsettings get org.mate.interface menus-have-icons

listitem.para: (b) Whether buttons may display an icon in addition to the button text.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/buttons-have-icons $ gsettings get org.mate.interface buttons-have-icons

listitem.para: (b) Whether the user can detach menubars and move them around.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/menubar-detachable $ gsettings get org.mate.interface menubar-detachable

listitem.para: (b) Whether the user can detach toolbars and move them around.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/toolbar-detachable $ gsettings get org.mate.interface toolbar-detachable

listitem.para: (s) Size of icons in toolbars, either "small-toolbar" or "large-toolbar".

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/toolbar-icons-size $ gsettings get org.mate.interface toolbar-icons-size

listitem.para: (b) Whether the cursor should blink.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/cursor-blink $ gsettings get org.mate.interface cursor-blink

listitem.para: (i) Length of the cursor blink cycle, in milliseconds.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/cursor-blink-time $ gsettings get org.mate.interface cursor-blink-time

listitem.para: (s) Icon theme to use for the panel, Caja etc.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/icon-theme $ gsettings get org.mate.interface icon-theme

listitem.para: (s) Basename of the default theme used by gtk+.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-theme $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-theme

listitem.para: (s) Basename of the default theme used by gtk+.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-key-theme $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-key-theme

listitem.para: (s) A '\n' separated list of "name:color" as defined by the 'gtk-color-scheme' setting

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-color-scheme $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-color-scheme

listitem.para: (s) Name of the default font used by gtk+.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/font-name $ gsettings get org.mate.interface font-name

listitem.para: (s) Name of the GTK+ input method Preedit Style used by gtk+.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-im-preedit-style $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-im-preedit-style

listitem.para: (s) Name of the GTK+ input method Status Style used by gtk+.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-im-status-style $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-im-status-style

listitem.para: (s) Name of the input method module used by GTK+.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-im-module $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-im-module

listitem.para: (b) Whether builtin GTK+ dialogs such as the file chooser, the color chooser or the font chooser will use a header bar at the top to show action widgets, or an action area at the bottom. This setting does not affect custom dialogs using GtkDialog directly, or message dialogs.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-dialogs-use-header $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-dialogs-use-header

listitem.para: (b) Whether built-in GTK+ scrolled windows will use overlay scrolling. Overlay scrolling hides and reduces the size of the scrollbar until it gets focus.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-overlay-scrolling $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-overlay-scrolling

listitem.para: (b) Whether to enable toolkit-wide animations.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-enable-animations $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-enable-animations

listitem.para: (s) Name of the default font used for reading documents.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/document-font-name $ gsettings get org.mate.interface document-font-name

listitem.para: (s) Name of a monospaced (fixed-width) font for use in locations like terminals.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/monospace-font-name $ gsettings get org.mate.interface monospace-font-name

listitem.para: (b) Whether to use a custom font in gtk+ applications.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/use-custom-font $ gsettings get org.mate.interface use-custom-font

listitem.para: (b) Whether to display a status bar meter on the right.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/status-bar-meter-on-right $ gsettings get org.mate.interface status-bar-meter-on-right

listitem.para: (s) Module to use as the filesystem model for the GtkFileChooser widget. Possible values are "gio" and "gtk+".

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/file-chooser-backend $ gsettings get org.mate.interface file-chooser-backend

listitem.para: (s) Keyboard shortcut to open the menu bars.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/menubar-accel $ gsettings get org.mate.interface menubar-accel

listitem.para: (b) Whether the context menus of entries and text views should offer to change the input method.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/show-input-method-menu $ gsettings get org.mate.interface show-input-method-menu

listitem.para: (b) Whether the context menus of entries and text views should offer to insert control characters.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/show-unicode-menu $ gsettings get org.mate.interface show-unicode-menu

listitem.para: (s) This setting determines which buttons should be put in the titlebar of client-side decorated windows, and whether they should be placed at the left of right. See https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkSettings.html#GtkSettings--gtk-decoration-layout.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-decoration-layout $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-decoration-layout

listitem.para: (b) This setting determines where application menu will be displayed - in a window or on a panel with MenuModel protocol. See https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkSettings.html#GtkSettings--gtk-shell-shows-app-menu.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-shell-shows-app-menu $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-shell-shows-app-menu

listitem.para: (b) This setting determines where window menubars will be displayed - in a window or on a panel with MenuModel protocol. See https://developer.gnome.org/gtk3/stable/GtkSettings.html#GtkSettings--gtk-shell-shows-menubar.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-shell-shows-menubar $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-shell-shows-menubar

listitem.para: (b) Whether mnemonics should be automatically shown and hidden when the user presses the Alt key.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/automatic-mnemonics $ gsettings get org.mate.interface automatic-mnemonics

listitem.para: (i) This controls the GTK scale factor that maps from window coordinates to the actual device pixels. On traditional systems this is 1, but on very high density displays (e.g. HiDPI, Retina) this can be a higher value (often 2). Set to 0 to auto-detect.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/window-scaling-factor $ gsettings get org.mate.interface window-scaling-factor

listitem.para: (b) This setting determines whether MATE controls the scale factor for QT applications. Enable to synchronize with the GTK scale factor when initializing the session, disable to control this value elsewhere. Requires restarting your session.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/window-scaling-factor-qt-sync $ gsettings get org.mate.interface window-scaling-factor-qt-sync

listitem.para: (b) If true, gtk+ uses the primary paste selection, usually triggered by a middle mouse button click.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/interface/gtk-enable-primary-paste $ gsettings get org.mate.interface gtk-enable-primary-paste

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.lockdown

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (b) Prevent the user from accessing the terminal or specifying a command line to be executed. For example, this would disable access to the panel's "Run Application" dialog.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-command-line $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-command-line

listitem.para: (b) Prevent the user from saving files to disk. For example, this would disable access to all applications' "Save as" dialogs.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-save-to-disk $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-save-to-disk

listitem.para: (b) Prevent the user from printing. For example, this would disable access to all applications' "Print" dialogs.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-printing $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-printing

listitem.para: (b) Prevent the user from modifying print settings. For example, this would disable access to all applications' "Print Setup" dialogs.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-print-setup $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-print-setup

listitem.para: (b) Prevent the user from switching to another account while his session is active.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-user-switching $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-user-switching

listitem.para: (b) Prevent the user from locking the screen.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-lock-screen $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-lock-screen

listitem.para: (b) Prevent running any URL or MIME type handler applications.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-application-handlers $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-application-handlers

listitem.para: (b) Prevent the user from changing theme settings.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-theme-settings $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-theme-settings

listitem.para: (b) Prevent the user from logging out.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/lockdown/disable-log-out $ gsettings get org.mate.lockdown disable-log-out

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.peripherals-keyboard

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/repeat $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard repeat
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/click $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard click
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/rate $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard rate
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/delay $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard delay
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/click-volume $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard click-volume

listitem.para: (s) possible values are "on", "off", and "custom".

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/bell-mode $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard bell-mode
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/bell-pitch $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard bell-pitch
$ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/bell-duration $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard bell-duration

listitem.para: (s) File name of the bell sound to be played.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/bell-custom-file $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard bell-custom-file

listitem.para: (b) When set to true, MATE will remember the state of the NumLock LED between sessions.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/remember-numlock-state $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard remember-numlock-state

listitem.para: () The remembered state of the NumLock LED.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/keyboard/numlock-state $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-keyboard numlock-state

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.peripherals-mouse

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (b) Swap left and right mouse buttons for left-handed mice.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/left-handed $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse left-handed

listitem.para: (d) Acceleration multiplier for mouse motion. A value of -1 is the system default.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/motion-acceleration $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse motion-acceleration

listitem.para: (i) Distance in pixels the pointer must move before accelerated mouse motion is activated. A value of -1 is the system default.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/motion-threshold $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse motion-threshold

listitem.para: (i) Distance before a drag is started.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/drag-threshold $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse drag-threshold

listitem.para: (i) Length of a double click.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/double-click $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse double-click

listitem.para: (b) Enables middle mouse button emulation through simultaneous left and right button click.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/middle-button-enabled $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse middle-button-enabled

listitem.para: (b) Highlights the current location of the pointer when the Control key is pressed and released.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/locate-pointer $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse locate-pointer

listitem.para: (s) Cursor theme name.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/cursor-theme $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse cursor-theme

listitem.para: (i) Size of the cursor referenced by cursor_theme.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/peripherals/mouse/cursor-size $ gsettings get org.mate.peripherals-mouse cursor-size

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/sound/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/sound/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.sound

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (s) The default mixer device used by the multimedia key bindings.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/sound/default-mixer-device $ gsettings get org.mate.sound default-mixer-device

listitem.para: (as) The default mixer tracks used by the multimedia key bindings.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/sound/default-mixer-tracks $ gsettings get org.mate.sound default-mixer-tracks

listitem.para: (b) Enable sound server startup.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/sound/enable-esd $ gsettings get org.mate.sound enable-esd

listitem.para: (b) Whether to play sounds on user events.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/sound/event-sounds $ gsettings get org.mate.sound event-sounds

listitem.para: (s) The XDG sound theme to use for event sounds.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/sound/theme-name $ gsettings get org.mate.sound theme-name

listitem.para: (b) Whether to play sounds on input events.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/sound/input-feedback-sounds $ gsettings get org.mate.sound input-feedback-sounds

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/thumbnail-cache/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/thumbnail-cache/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.thumbnail-cache

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (i) Maximum age for thumbnails in the cache, in days. Set to -1 to disable cleaning.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/thumbnail-cache/maximum-age $ gsettings get org.mate.thumbnail-cache maximum-age

listitem.para: (i) Maximum size of the thumbnail cache, in megabytes. Set to -1 to disable cleaning.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/thumbnail-cache/maximum-size $ gsettings get org.mate.thumbnail-cache maximum-size

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/thumbnailers/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/thumbnailers/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.thumbnailers

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (b) Set to true to disable all external thumbnailer programs, independent on whether they are independently disabled/enabled.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/thumbnailers/disable-all $ gsettings get org.mate.thumbnailers disable-all

listitem.para: (as) Thumbnails will not be created for files whose mime-type is contained in the list.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/thumbnailers/disable $ gsettings get org.mate.thumbnailers disable

section.title: Dconf Directory: /org/mate/desktop/typing-break/
section.para: To obtain the list of dconf keys, run one of the following commands:

para.screen: $ dconf list /org/mate/desktop/typing-break/ $ gsettings list-keys org.mate.typing-break

section.para: In the following list of dconf keys, the data type of the dconf key is shown in parentheses, next to its description, if available. The list also contains an example to read the value of the key using the dconf or gsettings commands.

listitem.para: (i) Number of minutes of typing time before break mode starts.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/typing-break/type-time $ gsettings get org.mate.typing-break type-time

listitem.para: (i) Number of minutes that the typing break should last.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/typing-break/break-time $ gsettings get org.mate.typing-break break-time

listitem.para: (b) Whether or not the typing break screen can be postponed.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/typing-break/allow-postpone $ gsettings get org.mate.typing-break allow-postpone

listitem.para: (b) Whether or not keyboard locking is enabled.

para.screen: $ dconf read /org/mate/desktop/typing-break/enabled $ gsettings get org.mate.typing-break enabled
